bibl.title: Letter from Bonnie Truby to Aurelio F. Concheso, April 24, 1954 [Enclosed in 04709024]

div1.p: Truby thanks Concheso for the Finlay Medal awarded to her late husband, and adds that her daughter will accept the medal for her father.

div1.head: Letter from Bonnie Truby to Aurelio F. Concheso, April 24, 1954 [Enclosed in t04709024]
div1.opener:
COPY
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco 18, California
April 24, 1954
Honorable Aurelio F. Concheso
Ambassador of Cuba
Cuban Embassy
Washington, D. C.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
This is to acknowledge your telegram of April 23, 1954, addressed
to General Albert E. Truby, which was received by me, his widow.
I regret to inform you that General Truby died on March 3, 1954, at
the Letterman Army Hospital, in the Presidio of San Francisco,
California.

Please accept my sincere thanks for the great compliment the Cuban
Government has paid General Truby in the award of the Finlay Decora-
tion. My one regret is that General Truby did not live to receive
this honor himself as he had looked forward to this event with
great pleasure. However, I know that there would be nothing which
would have pleased him more than to have a member of his family
receive this decoration which you desire to present on behalf of the
Cuban Government. Inasmuch as it would be impossible for me to be
present in Washington on April 29, I am hoping that you will present
the Finlay Decoration to our daughter, Mrs. B. L. LaGarde, who lives
in nearby Maryland. I am asking Mrs. LaGarde to telephone you at the
Cuban Embassy on Tuesday, April 27th on this matter and to make the
necessary arrangements for April 29th. My daughter would be proud
indeed to represent her Father on this important occasion and I
trust that the presentation of the Finlay Medal may be made to her
on behalf of General Truby.

As you may know, General Truby felt, in his opinion, that Dr. Carlos
Finlay was one of the outstanding men in the medical world of South
and Central America. He knew Dr. Finlay well when he lived at
La Punta in 1898-1899. I am enclosing for your information a copy of
a recent letter he wrote to the Reverend Kelly in Cuba about
Dr. Finlay.
